overview: The purpose of this Act is to emphasize the importance of compliance with the requirements enacted by Acts 62 and 199. [1] The bill explicitly states that the defense of good faith compliance is unavailable to any condominium association whose board adopts a budget that omits the required budget summary. [1] It also clarifies the ability to enforce compliance with budget summary and replacement reserves requirements and provides that an association has the burden of proving compliance. [1]
